description.narrative: Den planerade utvecklingsinsatsen syftar till att stötta oberoende informationsspridning i Turkiet för att bidra till ökad mediapluralism i landet. På så vis ses insatsen vara ett stöd till ökad yttrandefrihet och ambassaden bedömer att insatsen på sikt kan bidra till ökat ansvarsutkrävande gällande yttrandefrihet och demokrati. Det planerade svenska stödet till Medyascope.tv bereds som ett projektstöd utifrån syftet att stötta organisationens kärnverksamhet så att den kan fortlöpa under rådande omständigheter.

The planned contribution aims to support dissemination of independent information in Turkey through support to independent media to enable a pluralistic environment of available independent information. The contribution is therefore supporting freedom of expression and the Embassy assesses that it in time can contribute to increased accountability regarding freedom of expression and democracy. The planned Swedish support to Medyascope.tv is made through a project-grant with the aim to support Medyascope’s core activities so that the media platform can continue to undertake its work under the current circumstances.

description.narrative: Medyascope provides a platform for NGOs who would like to present their work through weekly shows. At present, Medyascope offers screentime to 5 programs that are dedicated to NGO/civil society works:1. Yurttas Postasi (Citizen Post): It is produced by Helsinki Citizens’ Assembly and dedicated to various issues regarding civil liberties. 2. Sehir Hepimizin (The City Belongs to All): Sehir Hepimizin is prepared and presented by the Istanbul Hepimizin Collective (Istanbul Belongs to All), working on improving participatory democracy at neighborhood and municipal levels. Each week they discuss a subject related to the urban life and participatory governance. 3. Gündem Çocuk (Agenda: Children): Gündem Çocuk is prepared and presented by the Gündem Çocuk association which works on improving the conditions for children in Turkey, and contributing to the fight against child abuse.4. Her Sartta Spor (Sports Under All Circumstances): Her Sartta Spor is produced by Medyascope, but regularly features representatives of NGOs working with disadvantaged groups such as the disabled.5. Sosyal Hukuk (Social Law): Sosyal Hukuk is prepared by presented by the Sosyal Hukuk platform that seeks to empower rights advocacy in Turkey. One of Medyascope's aims was to become a point of attraction for journalism students and/or students interested in journalism. Now, Medyascope has around 10 full time interns from leading universities in Turkey such as Sabanci, Bogaziçi and Galatasaray, working with Medyascope and learning the details of the craft. Following the change in the administration of Cumhuriyet, a well-respected daily newspaper in Turkey, a number of journalists and columnists lost their jobs due to ideological reasons. Medyascope started giving screentime to three of these journalists (Erdem Gül, Kemal Can and Kadri Gürsel) to run regular weekly shows on Medyascope.
